flowRoot.flowPara: Request comes in from client tools to openshift.redhat.com over a JSON/REST(ish) api. This is documented.
Once created, the client communicates directly with the node for some operations (git push, snapshot, etc)
broker is rails based, communicates to mcollective via qpid.
S3 is used to store information about users and applications
streamline is SSO and is tied to RH's RHN account system
mcollective is an opensource coordination project. It has a client portion and server portion. The server is running on each node and the client is on the express broker
Facts are a feature of mcollective to get information about nodes and filter based on them
nodes are where our user applications run. The mcollective server sends information about how full the node is. Mcollective runs the cartridges on the node and sends the proper flags in
